This property verifies that the state machine's current state is set to STOPPED one clock cycle after reset is asserted.

The property triggers on every positive edge of the clock signal clk_i and is disabled when the reset signal rst_i is low (active-high reset). When rst_i becomes high, the property requires that on the next clock cycle, the cur_state signal must equal the previous value of the STOPPED signal from the cycle when reset was asserted.
